intro: Dorstenia christenhuszii, commonly known as the "Coral Tree," is a unique member of the Moraceae family, native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its distinctive coral-like inflorescences, which are composed of numerous small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, grayish bark and palmate leaves that are often lobed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is a sought-after plant among collectors and botanists.
